{{Infobox NFL_season | logo = | team = Dallas Cowboys | year = 2011 | record = 7â5 | division_place = 1st [[NFC East]] | coach = [[Jason Garrett]] | owner = [[Jerry Jones]] | stadium = [[Cowboys Stadium]] | playoffs = TBA | pro bowlers = TBD | uniform = | AP All-pros = | next = 2012 }} The '''[[2011 NFL season|2011]] [[Dallas Cowboys]] season''' will be the Cowboys' 52nd season in the NFL, the third season playing their home games at [[Cowboys Stadium]] and the first full season under head coach [[Jason Garrett]], who served as the interim head coach for the team's final eight games in [[2010 Dallas Cowboys season|2010]]. The team will then seek to improve on their 6â10 record from 2010, with the 9th pick in the [[2011 NFL Draft]]. {{TOClimit|3}} ==Offseason== ===2011 draft board=== {{Main|2011 NFL Draft}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! Round !! Selection !! Player !! Position !! College |- ! 1 || 9 | [[Tyron Smith]] || [[Offensive tackle|OT]] || [[USC Trojans football|USC]] |- ! 2 || 40 | [[Bruce Carter (American football)|Bruce Carter]] || [[Inside linebacker|ILB]] || [[North Carolina Tarheels football|North Carolina]] |- ! 3 || 71 | [[Demarco Murray]] || [[Running back|RB]] || [[Oklahoma Sooners football|Oklahoma]] |- ! 4 || 110 | [[David Arkin (American football)|David Arkin]]|| [[Offensive guard|G]] || [[Missouri State Bears football|Missouri State]] |- ! 5 || 143 | [[Josh Thomas (cornerback)|Josh Thomas]] || [[Cornerback|CB]] || [[Buffalo Bulls football|Buffalo]] |- ! 6 || 176 | [[Dwayne Harris]] || [[Wide receiver|WR]] || [[East Carolina Pirates football|East Carolina]] |- ! 7 || 220 {{ref|Patrick Crayton trade|[a]}} | [[Shaun Chapas]] || [[Fullback (American football)|FB]] || [[Georgia Bulldogs football|Georgia]] |- ! 7 || 252 {{ref|Compensatory selection|[b]}} | [[Bill Nagy]] || [[Center (American football)|C]] || [[Wisconsin Badgers football|Wisconsin]] |} :{{note|Patrick Crayton trade|[a]}} The Cowboys forfeited its original seventh-round selection after selecting [[Defensive tackle|DT]] [[Josh Brent]] in the [[2010 NFL Draft|2010]] [[National Football League Draft#Supplemental Draft|Supplemental Draft]]. The Cowboys later acquired a new seventh-round selection in a September 2010 trade that sent [[Wide receiver|WR]] [[Patrick Crayton]] to the [[San Diego Chargers]]. :{{note|Compensatory selection|[b]}} [[National Football League Draft#Compensatory picks|Compensatory selection]]. they practiced in the summer ==Preseason== ===Schedule=== The Cowboys' preseason schedule was announced on April 12, 2011. {| class="wikitable" "align=center" |- ! rowspan="2" | Week !! rowspan="2" | Date !! rowspan="2" | Kickoff !! rowspan="2" | Opponent !! colspan="2" | Results !! rowspan="2" | Game site !! rowspan="2" | TV !! rowspan="2" | NFL.com

DAL â * WAS â ;Top rushers * DAL â * WAS â ;Top receivers * DAL â * WAS â ;Top tacklers * DAL â * WAS â }} ====Week 12: vs. Miami Dolphins==== '''[[Thanksgiving Classic]]''' {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Dallas Cowboys}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Dallas Cowboys}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Twelve: Miami Dolphins at Dallas Cowboys â Game summary |date=November 24 |time=3:15 p.m. CST |road=Dolphins |R1=3|R2=3|R3=10|R4=3 |home='''Cowboys''' |H1=0|H2=10|H3=0|H4=10 |stadium=Cowboys Stadium, Arlington, Texas |attendance=87,418 |weather=Played indoors (retractable roof closed) |referee=[[Pete Morelli]] |TV=CBS |TVAnnouncers=Jim Nantz and Phil Simms |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter ;Second quarter ;Third quarter ;Fourth quarter |stats= ;Top passers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top rushers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top receivers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top tacklers * MIA â * DAL â }} Coming off their thrilling overtime road win over the Redskins. the Cowboys went home, donned their throwback uniforms, and played a Week 12 interconference duel with the [[Miami Dolphins]] in the annual Thanksgiving game. Dallas trailed early in the first quarter with Dolphins kicker [[Shayne Graham]] getting a 26-yard field goal, yet the Cowboys would answser in the second quarter with a 26-yard field goal from kicker [[Dan Bailey (American football)|Dan Bailey]], followed by quarterback [[Tony Romo]] finding wide receiver [[Laurent Robinson]] on a 5-yard touchdown pass. Miami would close out the half with Graham making a 28-yard field goal. The Dolphins retook the lead in the third quarter with Grahan booting a 27-yard field goal, followed by quarterback [[Matt Moore (American football)|Matt Moore]] completing a 35-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver [[Brandon Marshall]]. Afterwards, Dallas regained the lead in the fourth quarter with Romo connecting with Robinson again on an 18-yard touchdown pass. Miami struck back with Graham making a 23-yard field goal, yet the Cowboys got the last laugh with Bailey nailing the game-ending 28-yard field goal. With the win, Dallas improved to 7-4. Bailey (2/2 on field goal, including game-winning 28-yarder) and linebacker [[DeMarcus Ware]] (1 assist & a fumble recovery) were named [[NFL on CBS]]' All-Iron Award winners. ====Week 13: at Arizona Cardinals==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Dallas Cowboys}};
